subject: Travel
title: Wilfred Thesiger Crosses the Empty Quarter
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Wilfred Thesiger Crosses the Empty Quarter.

hook.text: The Empty Quarter of Arabia is the largest sand desert on Earth. Almost nothing lives there.

buildup.text: In the late 1940s, British explorer Wilfred Thesiger crossed it twice with Bedouin companions.

discovery.text: They survived on dates and camel milk, navigating by stars across 600 miles of dunes.

twist.text: Thesiger didn't use the journey for fame. He wrote that the desert taught him how little humans need.

climax.text: He called his years with the Bedouin the most meaningful of his life.

punchline.text: He crossed the emptiest place and found it full.

quiz.question: What is the Empty Quarter?
options: The largest sand desert in Arabia
A region in the Gobi Desert
